strings.Value: "It was a pleasure meeting you. May I take my leave."

{n}{d|Natala}Natala{/d} {g|House Surtova}Surtova{/g} is discussing something with an unfamiliar old lady in a low voice. Upon noticing you, she breaks into a sugary sweet smile.{/n} "You were not only tough, but quick! Well, congratulations on your victory. Enjoy it... while you can."
"I would never. I simply wished to warn you, in case you don't fully realize the fate that awaits you and your barony."

"Nothing good, I fear. The Aldori, our dearest friends, didn't deem it necessary to inform you of their plans, I assume? You see, they're preparing to separate from {g|Brevoy}Brevoy{/g} — it will not be a peaceful process."

"They lack the strength, currently — hence using this legal loophole to create some 'independent' allies. Once the civil war breaks out, your lands will be the first to endure a strike from {g|Brevoy}Brevoy's{/g} forces. Perhaps they'll erect a memorial stone in independent {g|Restov}Restov{/g} to honor you... Well, I wouldn't count on even that, really."

"In your situation, the most reasonable course of action would be to align yourself with the lawful rulers of {g|Brevoy}Brevoy{/g} — the noble Houses. {g|Swordlords}The Aldori{/g} won't dare to rebel, knowing they will immediately become entrapped. You could help Brevoy avoid a civil war, while simultaneously enjoying some well-deserved peace in your lands."

"I believe Jamandi has already attempted to impose a guard on you as an emissary? I'm guessing her lowborn stepson — the green-skinned boy, Kassil. It's up to you, of course, but I would recommend you a different envoy. Please meet Shandra Mervey, an experienced diplomat who's more familiar with Brevoy's politics than any brawler could be."
"Before you leave, please allow me to introduce someone to you."
"What a wonderful celebration! One thing is for certain — the Aldori know how to enjoy themselves."
{n}The old woman standing next to Natala gives you a slight bow.{/n} "I would be happy to help you establish diplomatic relations with {g|Brevoy}Brevoy{/g}."
"Think on it. Do not make any hasty decisions."
